thread.title: Nvidia (NVDA) Stock Drops to a Two-Month Low
thread.title_full: Nvidia (NVDA) Stock Drops to a Two-Month Low

author: Gary Thomson, Chief Operating Officer FXOpen UK
title: Nvidia (NVDA) Stock Drops to a Two-Month Low
text:
While the Nasdaq 100 index ( US Tech 100 mini on FXOpen) surged to an all-time high , Nvidia’s (NVDA) stock price fell below $131 during yesterday’s session — its lowest level since mid-October. This bearish move indicates potential weakness in Nvidia’s leadership position.
The decline might be driven by the impressive rally in Broadcom Inc. (AVGO) shares, one of Nvidia’s key competitors. AVGO shares soared by approximately 20% in a single day, followed by another strong gain, as anticipated . Buoyed by Broadcom’s robust 2025 forecast, AVGO shares have climbed 54% since early December, which could prompt investors to shift portfolios, selling NVDA in favor of AVGO.
According to technical analysis of Nvidia’s chart, the price is nearing the lower boundary of the blue channel, a key support level throughout 2024. Notably, bears successfully pushed the price lower from both the $150 and $140 levels (highlighted with arrows).
Nasdaq pre-market data showed NVDA trading below $130 today. If this drop fails to spark renewed demand for Nvidia, a leader in the AI-driven tech boom, it could signal further trouble for the stock.
However, analyst sentiment remains positive, according to TipRanks:
37 out of 40 analysts still recommend buying NVDA shares. The 12-month average price target stands at $177. FXOpen offers spreads from 0.0 pips and commissions from $1.50 per lot. Enjoy trading on MT4, MT5, TickTrader or TradingView trading platforms!
